intro: Linosyris grisea, commonly known as the gray linosyris, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its grayish-green foliage and small, yellow-orange flowers make it visually distinctive. Linosyris grisea is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along rocky outcrops.
